thread.title: Kershaw, Dodgers top Mets 3-1, force NLDS to decisive Game 5
thread.title_full: Kershaw, Dodgers top Mets 3-1, force NLDS to decisive Game 5

title: Kershaw, Dodgers top Mets 3-1, force NLDS to decisive Game 5
text:
Updated: 11:05 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 | Posted: 11:05 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 Kershaw, Dodgers top Mets 3-1, force NLDS to decisive Game 5 Related View Larger Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw (22) adjusts his cap between pitches against the New York Mets during the first inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) View Larger Los Angeles Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez (23) connects for an RBI base hit to centerfield against the New York Mets during the third inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) New York Mets pitcher Steven Matz (32) delivers against the Los Angeles Dodgers during the first inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK â€” 
Clayton Kershaw ended his five-game postseason skid with seven brilliant innings while pitching on three days' rest and the Los Angeles Dodgers beat the New York Mets 3-1 Tuesday night to force a deciding Game 5 in the NL Division series. 
The series shifts back to Dodger Stadium on Thursday. 
Game 2 winner Zack Greinke will try to lead the Dodgers to a spot in the NL Championship Series against the Chicago Cubs. Jacob deGrom, who beat Kershaw in Game 1, is set to start for the Mets. 
Kershaw gave up one run and three hits. The reigning NL MVP and Cy Young Award winner was 1-6 with a 4.99 ERA for his postseason career entering this start. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
